Why do some antivirus software like Avast and Kaspersky flag Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus software may flag Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it detects the presence of mining software, which could potentially be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can review the resources provided to understand more about these false positives.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/

# Notable Changes
- Set content hashes will be a key/value map instead of an array
- Improve invalid block and invalid transaction handling.# Verus ID and VerusHash 2.1 Network Upgrade
This is the third release candidate (RC3) for the next major upgrade to the Verus network. It is considered fully ready for testing on both VRSCTEST testnet and VRSC mainnet. While this release is likely to work fine on mainnet through the coming activation, it is not yet an official release that you should expect to support mainnet activation. If you install this version, please make sure to upgrade to an official release before network activation, which will happen at block 800200, expected to be mined or staked on December 15th.
This release enables two technology upgrades, one that would be considered big news to most cryptocurrency projects, an improvement to the FPGA-equalizing hash algorithm, and a revolutionary, new decentralized identity technology, Verus IDs, that will disrupt today’s centralized systems with the most secure, quantum ready, fully decentralized, self-sovereign digital identity system in the world.

What are the notable changes in this release candidate (RC3) of Verus?
The notable changes in this release candidate (RC3) include setting content hashes to be a key/value map instead of an array, and improving the handling of invalid blocks and transactions.

What is the purpose of the Verus ID and VerusHash 2.1 Network Upgrade?

The Verus ID and VerusHash 2.1 Network Upgrade is a major upgrade to the Verus network that enables two technology upgrades: an improvement to the FPGA-equalizing hash algorithm, and a revolutionary, new decentralized identity technology called Verus IDs. Verus IDs provide a secure, quantum-ready, fully decentralized, and self-sovereign digital identity system.

What are the benefits of Verus ID?

Verus ID provides several benefits, including built-in privacy through integration of zk-SNARKs, improved blockchain address security, the ability to recover lost funds, security against identity and key theft, the ability to prove things about yourself without revealing unnecessary details, and the ability to transfer assets to heirs.
